name: Agile Retrospective Essentials (Ext - SubAlpha Name - 1)
description: Make incremental improvements to the way of working through regular, repeated retrospectives.

activitySpaces.name: Support the Team
activitySpaces.description: Help the team members to help themselves, collaborate and improve their way of working. Support the team to: Improve team working, Overcome any obstacles, Improve ways of working.

activities.name: Hold a Retrospective
activities.description: The whole team meets regularly to reflect on its way of working. Improvements are identified and prioritized, and actions agreed. At the next retrospective, the results are evaluated.

alphas.name: Team
alphas.description: A group of people actively engaged in the development, maintenance, delivery or support of a specific software system. One or more teams plan and perform the work needed to create, update and/or change the software system.

states.name: Seeded
states.description: The team’s mission is clear and the know-how needed to grow the team is in place.

states.name: Formed
states.description: The team has been populated with enough committed people to start the mission.
checklists: Individual responsibilities accepted and aligned to competencies

states.name: Collaborating
states.description: The team members are working together as one unit.

states.name: Performing
states.description: The team is working effectively and efficiently.

states.name: Adjourned
states.description: The team is no longer accountable for carrying out its mission.

alphas.name: Work
alphas.description: Activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a result. In the context of software engineering, work is everything that the team does to meet the goals of producing a software system matching the requirements and addressing the opportunity presented by the stakeholders. The work is guided by the practices that make up the team’s way-of-working.

states.name: Initiated
states.description: The work has been requested.

states.name: Prepared
states.description: All pre-conditions for starting the work have been met.
checklists: At least one team member ready

states.name: Started
states.description: The work is proceeding.

states.name: Under Control
states.description: The work is going well, risks are under control, and productivity levels are sufficient to achieve a satisfactory result.

states.name: Concluded
states.description: The work to produce the results has been concluded.

states.name: Closed
states.description: All remaining housekeeping tasks have been completed and the work has been officially closed.

alphas.name: Way of Working
alphas.description: The tailored set of practices and tools used by a team to guide and support their work. The team evolves their way of working alongside their understanding of their mission and their working environment. As their work proceeds they continually reflect on their way of working and adapt it to their current context, if necessary.

states.name: Principles Established
states.description: The principles, and constraints, that shape the way-of-working are established.

states.name: Foundation Established
states.description: The key practices, and tools, that form the foundation of the way of working are selected and ready for use.
checklists: Practices needed to start work agreed
Gaps between available and needed way of working understood

states.name: In Use
states.description: Some members of the team are using, and adapting, the way-of-working.

states.name: In Place
states.description: All team members are using the way of working to accomplish their work.
checklists: Inspected and adapted by whole team

states.name: Working Well
states.description: The team’s way of working is working well for the team.

states.name: Retired
states.description: The way of working is no longer in use by the team.

subAlphas.name: Improvement
subAlphas.description: A possible adaptation to improve a Team’s Way of Working.

states.name: Identified
states.description: A possible adaptation to improve a team’s way of working has been identified.
checklists: A possible adaptation to improve a team’s way of working has been identified

states.name: Prioritized
states.description: A possible adaptation to improve a team’s way of working has been prioritized so support decisions on what to focus on improving and when.A possible adaptation to a team’s way of working has been prioritized to support decisions on what to focus on improving and when. Action Agreed
checklists: A possible adaptation to a team’s way of working has been prioritized to support decisions on what to focus on improving and when. Action Agreed

states.name: Action Agreed
states.description: It has been agreed what action to take to enact or otherwise respond to an improvement.
checklists: It has been agreed what action to take to enact or otherwise respond to an improvement
It is clear when the action will be taken
It is clear who is responsible for the action
It is agreed how the results of the actions will be measured to prove whether or not an improvement has been achieved

states.name: Trialed
states.description: The improvement has been enacted in such a way that the team is able to assess its success and decide whether to continue with the enactment, reverse out of it, or adapt it in some way.
checklists: The improvement has been enacted in such a way that the team is able to assess its success and decide whether to continue with the enactment, reverse out of it, or adapt it

states.name: Results Evaluated
states.description: The team has assessed the success or otherwise of the improvement.
checklists: The team has assessed the success or otherwise of the improvement
The team has agreed what changes to make to their future way of working as a result, if any

states.name: In Use
states.description: The improvement is in use and now a fully embedded part of the team’s way of working.
checklists: The improvement is now a fully embedded part of the team's agreed way of working

competencies.name: Leadership
competencies.description: The ability to inspire and motivate a group of people to achieve a successful conclusion to their work and to meet their objectives.

competencies.name: Management
competencies.description: The ability to coordinate, plan and track the work done by a team. The management competency is the administrative and organizational ability that enables the right things to be done at the right time to maximize a team’s chances of success.

patterns.name: Feedback
patterns.description: Feedback patterns establish mechanisms for assessing performance and adjusting the approach based on these assessments. Apply feedback patterns to: Assess performance and results, Seek input from stakeholders, Analyze reasons for underperformance, Ensure assessments are open and honest, Enable lessons to be learnt, Enable approaches to be adjusted.

pattern.name: Mad, Sad, Glad
pattern.description: A popular approach to team brainstorming to identify potential improvements. Team members write on sticky notes what has made them: Mad – frustrations, Sad – disappointments, Glad – things that went well. Part of its power is that it taps into people’s emotions, and results in an unfettered flow of ideas that the team can then analyze, prioritize and action.
